description: [GraÃ§a Machel Trust] In Africa's dynamic landscape of trade and agriculture, the partnership between the Graça Machel Trust's Network of African Business Women (NABW) and the Zambian Federation of Associations of Women in Business (ZFAWIB) is making noticeable progress. Established in 1993, ZFAWIB has developed a formidable track record under the visionary leadership of its Chief Executive Officer, Maureen Sumbwe. Maureen's dedication has helped many women acquire land for farming via land resettlement schemes, secure
title: Africa: Forging Strategic Alliances - Maureen Sumbwe's Journey With the Graça Machel Trust

description: [savethechildren_uk] Today marks the first-ever International Day of Play which has been declared by the United Nations General Assembly to champion and protect children's right to play.
title: Africa: First-Ever International Day of Play Marked to Help Children Reach Full Potential

description: [African Arguments] Investing $1 billion in early warning systems would avoid $35 billion in losses each year.
title: Africa: Funding Early Warning Systems Will Save Lives and Pay for Itself in No Time

description: [The Herald] Russian Foreign Minister Sergey Lavrov recently concluded his latest tour of Africa, visiting four countries in two regions of a continent where Western governments have expressed concern about their declining influence in recent years.
title: Africa: Key Points From Lavrov's African Tour

description: [The Conversation Africa] Nearly a decade has passed since migration to Europe from Africa and the Middle East reached a peak in 2015, referred to as the year of the "migrant crisis". Over a million people from Africa and the Middle East applied for asylum in the European Union (EU).
title: Africa: EU Migration Policy Is Getting Tougher - the 3 New Tactics Used to Keep African Migrants Out

description: [The Conversation Africa] To many people around the world bicycles are a crucial means of transport, especially for carrying loads in rural areas. While their benefits are huge and many organisations are working on making access to bicycles a reality, a range of barriers still prevent them from being more widely available in low-income communities - not least of these being their cost. A team of researchers has produced a new report called Access to Affordable Bicycles in Africa. We asked team leader Daniel Frey about their study
title: Africa: Bicycles Can Change Lives, Especially in Rural Africa

description: [UN News] Hundreds of people with disabilities, non-governmental organizations (NGOs) and civil society representatives alongside ambassadors from around the world are due to meet at UN Headquarters in New York on Tuesday to discuss the challenges and opportunities in terms of work, cutting-edge tech and humanitarian crises as well as conflict and climate disasters.
title: Africa: What's Going On At COSP17?

description: [Unicef] New York -- New data also reveal many young children are deprived of play, stimulation, and interaction with their parents and caregivers
title: Africa: Nearly 400 Million Young Children Worldwide Regularly Experience Violent Discipline At Home - Unicef

description: [SNA] Port Sudan -- Acting Federal Minister of Health, Dr. Haitham Mohamed Ibrahim, has appreciated the growing role that the State of Qatar and the Qatar Red Crescent continued to play in the country, along with the international organizations, in medical supplies, and the effective contribution to all health sectors in the various states.
title: Africa: Health Minister Meets Official of Africa Unit in Qatar Red Crescent

description: [VOA] African elephants call each other and respond to unique names, a phenomenon that is rare among wild animals, new research shows.
title: Africa: African Elephants Call Each Other Unique Names, New Study Shows
